title: Welcome Back, Nature’s Nurture!

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
Yay, we’re back!! After some much needed time away from posting, we’re finally back and looking pretty snazzy if I do say so myself! We’ve been working very hard behind the scenes to take care of some technical issues to make the site run more smoothly, so I’ll talk more about some of those changes below.

But before we move on, I have one question for you: How about this new look, eh? Ahhh, I’m so excited to finally unveil the long-awaited redesign and branding of the new Nature’s Nurture! It’s been just about a year since this little old blog went live (more blogiversary celebration info coming soon!), and Im’ so humbled by just how quickly it’s grown in that short amount of time. We definitely outgrew our old site’s theme and setup, and couldn’t be happier with these awesome changes.

Email Subscriptions

We’re now using MailChimp for our emails and will be switching to a weekly digest email, with the past week’s posts, sent out every Friday morning! No more cluttered inboxes – yay! We’ll also be rolling out some new email lists in case you’d like to be notified about other things like giveaways or other promotions.

New Header & Menu

We’ve moved some stuff around and added a few new tabs to the menu. Notable additions are:

  • Categories have been moved to the menu bar for easy access and browsing through specific areas of interest.
  • Featured Posts shows all of our posts that have been featured at other sites.
  • Recipes can now be accessed from the menu and are broken down into subcategories.
  • Shop page will help you find specific products mentioned in posts, as well as my affiliate links.
  • Resources is basically the old ‘Topics I Love’ page, and has links about topics like parenting, homesteading, etc.
  • Search bar has been moved to the menu for easier access.

New Button

What would a blog redesign be without some new branding, right? Check out our new button, and feel free to grab one from the footer and place it on your site, if you feel so inclined. If you’re interested in a button swap and your site is a good fit for our readers, please contact me!

New Footer

A few things have been moved to the footer all the way at the bottom of the page; most notable are the tag cloud, the archives, my button, and a quick site navigation.

Updated Posting Schedule

Posts will be published on Monday thru Friday, with the weekly digest email going out on Friday morning, and no posts on the weekend. A typical week should look like this:

  • Mondays: Either a recipe for Meatless Monday or the latest installment of my current post series.
  • Tiny Tip Tuesday (blog hop): Bloggers from all over the web share their best posts of the week. The link with the highest number of clicks gets featured the following week, so be sure to check out the links each week and get your clicks in by Sunday night!
  • Wednesdays: This will be my ‘whatever’ day – no set guideline for what I may post, if anything at all. Guest posts, sponsored posts, and reviews and giveaways will be posted on Wednesdays as well.
  • Thrifty Thursday (New!): Posts that focus on the homemade aspect of Nature’s Nurture, like how-to’s, repurposing, DIY, etc. – pretty much the bulk of my posts. 🙂
  • Fridays: Weekly Digest newsletter with all posts from the past week.
  • Sundays: Click-votes for Tiny Tip Tuesday will close at the end of Sunday each week.

*I’m also toying with the idea of maybe starting an opt-in monthly newsletter with a round-up of my favorite finds from the internet, or maybe a listing of the best green giveaways coming up each month… I don’t know, maybe. We can talk more about that later. 🙂

New PR/Advertising Info

I’m now using Passionfruit Ads to manage my ad space for sponsors, as well as button swaps. It’s a really great app with a lot of automation and streamlining, so things should run much more efficiently in that respect. If you’re interested in working with us, please visit our new advertising and PR pages!

So take a look around, and let us know how you like the new look and feel! I’d love to hear your feedback in the comments, and if there’s something urgent, please feel free to contact me!

We’ve been working very hard behind the scenes to take care of some technical issues to make the site run more smoothly, so I’ll talk more about some of those changes […]

title: #TinyTipTues 21: Special Announcements!

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
Happy Tuesday everyone! I hope you all had a wonderful weekend and and you’re week is off to a great start! 🙂

Phew! Ok, everything I’ve written to this point has ended in an exclamation point, so I think it’s safe to assume that I’m pretty excited (and a little anxious) about today’s post. 🙂

First off, I just want to wish my Muslim readers an Eid Mubarak! If you’re following along with us at Instagram, you may have noticed the Ramadan themed photos over the past month. Ramadan is one of the months in the Islamic calendar – the month of fasting, spiritual cleansing, and remembrance of the less fortunate. And on Sunday, we celebrated the Eid (feast/celebration) – a culmination of the 30 day journey through Ramadan.

I’ve got a very special announcement today! We have some very exciting changes coming to Nature’s Nurture! Over the next week and a half, we’re going to be getting a HUGE facelift! Not just cosmetically, but mechanically as well. There’s a lot of work that I’ve been meaning to take care of behind the scenes here, and I’m really falling behind because I’m also having to keep up with our regularly scheduled posts.

So after today, we’re taking a very short hiatus until the end of the month so we can finish up some of the awesome things we’ve been working on. Eek! I’m so excited!

Don’t worry, the site’s not going anywhere. It’ll still be business as usual, and will continue to be accessible during this time – just no new posts in the meantime. Responses to comments may also take a little while, but just know that I do read every single comment as it comes in. 😉

As always, thanks for being the awesome readers that you are! See you soon 🙂

Tiny Tip Tuesday Blog Hop!

Now for the blog hop! Thanks so much to everyone who joined us and shared their awesome links last week! If you missed them, head on over and check them out!

Just a quick note: Since we’re going on hiatus, there will be NO Tiny Tip Tuesday next week! Today’s party will stay live until Sunday night, but this post will stay on the front page of the blog until our break is over – which means even more exposure for your awesome posts. So be sure to link up this week and we’ll be tracking clicks until we come back in September!

Ok, every week I share with you the top 3 most-clicked links from the previous week, right? They also get shared with our fans on Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest.

Everybody, meet Sara…

This week, ALL 3 LINKS came from my friend, Sara at My Merry Messy Life! I’ve talked about her before here, and she’s also been featured a few times at Tiny Tip Tuesday here, here, here, and here. And this week, you fine readers have unanimously expressed what I’ve been saying all along – Sara is pretty awesome 🙂

Check out Sara’s 3 links from last week. Then, please go show her some love on these wonderful posts. Thanks for sharing your awesome tips with us, Sara!

  1. Homemade Organic Lotion – A Recipe & Free Printable – This recipe looks amazing. So rich and creamy, can’t wait to try it!
  2. How to Have Gorgeous, Natural Curls & Care For Them – Some really awesome tips for those of us blessed with a little extra bounce in the hair department.
  3. All About Hydrogen Peroxide and How to Use It – It’s no secret how much I love hydrogen peroxide. Sara does a great write up of it’s many uses!

Alright, now what are YOUR tips for this week?

  • You may share any new links pertaining to anything natural, frugal, sustainable, or homemade. Things like kitchen tips, recipes, gardening tips, green cleaners, homemade beauty products, DIY projects, etc.
  • Use the permalink to the actual post (NOT your homepage!)
  • In the “Name” field below, enter the name of your post (NOT your name!)
  • Make sure to visit a couple of the other links, and show them some comment love! We all love comments!
  • Please include a link back to Nature’s Nurture in your post; either a text link or include the button below:
excerpt:
Happy Tuesday everyone! I hope you all had a wonderful weekend and and your week is off to a great start! 🙂

I’ve got some very exciting news about the future of Nature’s Nurture and can hardly contain myself! Please click the link below to read more about the upcoming changes and some important news in the meantime.

Also, Tiny Tip Tuesday is live, so make sure to keep checking back throughout the week to see all the wonderful tips everyone has shared!

title: Kicking The Plastic Habit {Book Review}

author.name: Sarah UmmYusuf
author.description: Sarah is a wife and mother with a passion for all things simple, natural, and homemade. Join her and thousands of others on their journey to a natural lifestyle!

content:
Photo Credit: My Plastic Free Life

Here it is. That raging topic making the headlines more and more each year: Plastic.

As consumers who try to live a green, eco-friendly lifestyle, we tand to have a love/hate relationship with plastic. The convenience can’t be beat; but the toll that plastics take on the environment, our health, and the effects they have on entire ecosystems, is just too large to ignore.

We’re all stuck in this limbo, and at times, it feels absolutely overwhelming! That’s how I felt a few years ago when I happened upon Beth Terry’s blog, My Plastic-Free LIfe (formerly Fake Plastic Fish). Here’s a woman who decided to take it upon herself to reduce, and almost completely eliminate, all plastics from her life. That’s right, ALL plastics. That means everything from food storage containers, to shampoo bottles, to plastic grocery bags. Anything made from or packaged in plastic.

That was back in 2007. Fast-forward to this year, and Beth has published an awesome book outlining everything she’s learned over the years!

Plastic-Free: How I Kicked the Plastic Habit and How You Can Too is chock-full of information, stories, and practical tips to help us all move a little closer to the ideal plastic-free life.

Photo Credit: My Plastic Free Life

This book is seriously for everyone. If you’re just getting your feet wet and still learning the basics about the harmful effects of plastics, Beth’s easy-going, never intimidating, always encouraging voice breaks everything down to a fundamental, easy-to-understand level. She talks about everything from the history of plastics (did you know the first plastics were actually biodegradable?), to the different kinds of plastics (ever wonder what those little numbers on the bottom of your containers mean?), to some basic rules for plastic recycling (just because it has the triangular “chasing arrows” symbol on it, does NOT mean your container is recyclable!).

Photo Credit: My Plastic Free Life

If you’re like me, and have been researching and learning about the dangers of plastics for some time, taking small steps to curb your use and disposal of plastics, Plastic-Free is for us, as well. In her ever-inspiring manner, Beth challenges us to learn more, do more, and most importantly, feel more! Are you avoiding taking the challenge to track your plastic consumption for fear of feeling guilty and defeated? Beth encourages us to embrace those feelings and let them do their thing, in order for us to truly look at our plastic habit in the most objective way possible.

My favorite chapters? Gosh, if I could list every one of them, I would. But for the sake of this review, let’s just say that plastic bags, plastic water bottles, and personal care & household cleaning were the topics that hit closest to home for me. Beth’s blog is actually what inspired me to first start bringing my own reusable shopping bags on grocery trips back in 2009. I bought those first bags, but Beth shares a super simple tutorial in her book for making your own reusable cloth bag from an old T-shirt – yay for up-cycling!

Photo Credit: My Plastic Free Life

In her chapter on grocery shopping, Beth gives some invaluable tips on reducing your plastic consumption when shopping for produce, as well as a wonderful guide for how to store that produce without using plastic containers or bags. My favorite part of that chapter is the five or six recipes she shares for things like ketchup, mayo, and chocolate syrup – thereby eliminating any packaging altogether. And you know how much I love anything homemade!

Photo Credit: My Plastic Free Life

I think the single most inspiring aspect of Plastic-Free is its practical application for everyday life. Numerous quick tips are highlighted throughout the book, and at the end of each chapter, Beth includes an Action Items Checklist, encouraging us to choose items that feel right for us, as well as challenging us to do one thing on the list that seems a little more difficult. One of my personal challenge items is to put together a reusable take-out kit, instead of bringing our take-out home in those plastic or styrofoam containers. Baby steps, right?

Photo Credit: My Plastic Free Life

And just when you thought this book couldn’t get any cooler? It does – it so does! In keeping in line with her commitment to go plastic-free, Beth made sure the entire book was manufactured without the use of plastics – ANY plastics! The cover, the spine, even the glue are all 100% plastic-free! You can literally compost the whole book! Read more about the process here.

Plastic-Free has something for everyone; be it facts and figures to awaken something deep down inside you, or a witty story to inspire you to make a small change in your life, or an action plan to help get the whole family involved. This book is a must-have for every home library. It’s literally life changing!

To buy your very own copy of Plastic-Free, and to learn more about Beth Terry, please check out the links below:

  • To purchase a copy of the book, click here.
  • Visit Beth’s blog: My Plastic-Free Life
  • Follow Beth on Facebook and Twitter
